definition: to eliminate counterrevolutionaries (abbr. for 肅清反革命份子|肃清反革命分子[su4 qing1 fan3 ge2 ming4 fen4 zi3])
respectful/solemn/to eliminate/to clean up
surname Su
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
purge of counterrevolutionaries (esp. Mao's purge of hidden counterrevolutionaries 1955-56 and Stalin's Great Purge 1936-38)

sentences.english: Our achievements in eliminating counter-revolutionaries must be affirmed.
sentences.chinese: 一定要肯定肅反的成績。

sentences.english: Thousands and thousands of intellectuals are persecuted in the "counter-revolutionary elimination".
sentences.chinese: 在“肅反”中傷害了數以百萬計的知識分子。

definition: Vietnam War (1955-1975)
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
student movement
United Front (either of the two alliances between the Guomindang and the Communist Party, 1923-1927 and 1937-1945)
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
many things waiting to be done (idiom)/a thousand things to do
Korean War (1950-1953)
Communist International or Comintern (1919-1943), also known as the Third International 第三國際|第三国际[Di4 san1 Guo2 ji4]
leadership authority
Marshal Josip Broz Tito (1892-1980), Yugoslav military and communist political leader, president of Yugoslavia 1945-1980
Korean War (1950-1953)
General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
army grouping/collective army
Zhang Tailei (1898-1927), founding member of Chinese communist party
